Source code for cfdna.multi_summary.cfDNA_multi_summary

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from NGSfragments.Segment.correction import correct, gaussian_smooth
from ..utilities.h5_utilities import read_multi_summary, write_multi_summary
from scipy.stats import pearsonr, spearmanr
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Tell matplot lib to use 'editable text'
import matplotlib
matplotlib.rcParams['pdf.fonttype'] = 42
matplotlib.rcParams['ps.fonttype'] = 42


def correct_field(values, cnv, field):
    """
    """
    import statsmodels.api as sm 

    # Find chroms
    chroms = np.unique(values.loc[:,"seqnames"].values)

    # Iterate over chroms
    corrected_values = values.loc[:,field].values.copy()
    values_median = np.median(corrected_values)
    for chrom in chroms:
        chrom_index = values.loc[:,"seqnames"].values==chrom
        # Record values
        chrom_values = values.loc[:,field].values[chrom_index]
        chrom_cnv = cnv.loc[:,field].values[chrom_index]
        # Correct values
        prediction = sm.nonparametric.lowess(chrom_values, chrom_cnv, frac=0.6666, return_sorted=False)
        residuals = (chrom_values - prediction)
        corrected_values[chrom_index] = residuals + values_median

    return corrected_values


def correct_cnv(values, cnv):
    """
    """

    # Iterate over samples
    samples = values.columns.values[3:]
    corrected_values = values.copy(deep=True)
    for sample in samples:
        corrected_values.loc[:,sample] = correct_field(values, cnv, sample)

    return corrected_values


def model_regress_feature(metric_df, outcomes, **kwargs):
    """
    """
    from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor

    # Train model
    model = RandomForestRegressor(**kwargs)
    model.fit(metric_df.iloc[:,3:].values.T)

    return model


def model_class_feature(metric_df, outcomes, **kwargs):
    """
    """
    from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

    # Train model
    model = RandomForestClassifier(**kwargs)
    model.fit(metric_df.iloc[:,3:].values.T)

    return model



[docs]class cfDNA_multi_summary(object):
    """
    Contains cfDNA summary results
    """

    def __init__(self, data, directory="./", verbose=False):
        """
        Initialize cfDNA_multi_summary object
        """

        # Set attributes
        self.verbose = verbose

        # Read metrics
        self.metrics = read_multi_summary(data, directory, verbose)

        # Determine tumor purity
        self.samples = self.metrics["cnv_bins"].columns.values[3:]
        self.n_samples = len(self.metrics["nfr"])
        self.purity = pd.Series(np.zeros(self.n_samples), index=self.samples)
        self.ploidy = pd.Series(np.zeros(self.n_samples), index=self.samples)
        for i in range(self.n_samples):
            hmm_loglik = self.metrics["hmm_loglik"][i]
            optimal_solution = np.argmax(hmm_loglik.loc[:,"loglik"].values)
            self.purity.iloc[i] = 1 - float(hmm_loglik.iloc[optimal_solution,:].loc["n_est"])
            self.ploidy.iloc[i] = float(hmm_loglik.iloc[optimal_solution,:].loc["phi_est"])

        # Determine nfr
        self.qc = pd.DataFrame(np.zeros((self.n_samples, 3)),
                               index=self.samples,
                               columns=["nfr","pos_score","median_var"])
        for i in range(self.n_samples):
            self.qc.iloc[i,0] = self.metrics["nfr"][i][0]
            self.qc.iloc[i,1] = self.metrics["nfr"][i][1]
            self.qc.iloc[i,2] = self.metrics["median_var"][i]


    def __len__(self):
        return self.n_samples


    def __getitem__(self, key):
        """
        Function like dictionary
        """

        return self.metrics[key]

    
    @property
    def bins(self):
        return self.metrics["cnv_bins"]

    
    @property
    def wps_bins(self):
        return self.metrics["wps_bins"]

    
    @property
    def nfr(self):
        return self.qc.loc[:,"nfr"]


    @property
    def median_var(self):
        return self.qc.loc[:,"median_var"]

    
    @property
    def pos_score(self):
        return self.qc.loc[:,"pos_score"]


    @property
    def length_dist(self):
        return self.metrics["length_dist"]

    

[docs]    def write_qc(self, output_fn, delimiter="\t"):
        """
        Write text file of quality control metrics
        """

        # Write qc metrics
        self.qc.to_csv(output_fn, index=True, header=True, sep=delimiter)




[docs]    def write_h5(self, output_h5):
        """
        Write h5 multi_summary
        """

        write_multi_summary(self.metrics, output_h5)




[docs]    def pca(self, feature="cnv_bins"):
        """
        Calculate PCA
        """
        from sklearn.decomposition import PCA

        # Initalize model
        pca = PCA()

        # Run PCA
        pca_Y = pca.fit_transform(self[feature].loc[:,self.samples].T)

        return pca_Y




[docs]    def sample_distance(self, feature="cnv_bins", method="pearson"):
        """
        Determine sample distance matrix
        """
        from scipy.stats import pearsonr, spearmanr

        # Determine distance metric
        if method == "pearson":
            func = pearsonr
        elif method == "spearman":
            func = spearmanr

        # Iterate over samples
        distance = np.zeros((self.n_samples, self.n_samples))
        for i in range(self.n_samples):
            sample1 = self.samples[i]
            for j in range(self.n_samples):
                sample2 = self.samples[j]
                distance[i,j] = func(self[feature].loc[:,sample1].values,
                                    self[feature].loc[:,sample2].values)[0]
        
        # Convert to DataFrame
        distance = pd.DataFrame(distance, index=self.samples, columns=self.samples)

        return distance




[docs]    def plot_length_dist(self, save=None, show=True):
        """
        Plot fragment length distributions
        """

        # Initialize matplotlib grid
        fig = plt.figure(figsize=(5, 7))
        gs = fig.add_gridspec(3, 1)

        # Normalize values
        values = (self.length_dist.T / np.max(self.length_dist, axis=1)).T
        mean_values = np.mean(values, axis=0)
        variance = np.var(values, axis=0)

        # Re-order values
        corr = np.array([spearmanr(values[i,:], mean_values)[0] for i in range(values.shape[0])])
        values = values[np.argsort(corr)[::-1],:]

        # Plot line graph
        with sns.axes_style("ticks"):
            line_ax = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, 0])
        x = np.arange(len(mean_values))
        line_ax.plot(x, mean_values, color="black")
        line_ax.fill_between(x, mean_values-variance, mean_values+variance, color="grey")
        sns.despine(ax=line_ax, top=True, right=True)
        line_ax.set_xlim((0,values.shape[1]))
        line_ax.set_title("Fragment length distribution")

        # Plot heatmap
        with sns.axes_style("ticks"):
            heat_ax = fig.add_subplot(gs[1:, 0])
        sns.heatmap(values, xticklabels=False, yticklabels=False, cbar=False, cmap="Purples", ax=heat_ax)

        # Save of display plot
        if save != None:
            plt.savefig(save, transparent=True, dpi=80)
        if show:
            plt.show()
